newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE grains active amid currency inspired rise.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE grains active amid currency inspired rise.

text.p: Continued sterling weakness sent LIFFE grain futures higher in active trade.
"It was mainly sterling, which was weak at the start and weakened through the day," one trader said.
Active May wheat last traded 0.90 stg higher at 102.00 stg. May volume was 400 lots of a total 876 on wheat.
The volume was pumped up by good shipper buying and some consumer interest, the trader said.
Barley also rose, with November most active. It last traded 0.75 stg up at 94.50 stg. November volume was 20 of a total 33 lots on barley.
Sterling dropped three pfennigs in Europe on Tuesday to its lowest level against the mark since February 4.

The UK unit has been weak since Conservative Prime Minister John Major announced on Monday that Britons would vote on May 1. Sterling's rate against the mark was also hit by overall mark strength on renewed EMU worries.
